sentences: Oede de la Couroierie (died 1294), also known as Eude de Carigas and Odo de Corigiaria, was a trouvère of Artois.
He is documented beginning in 1270 as a clerk in the house of Count Robert II, who often sent him on diplomatic missions.
His will, made in June 1294, providing for both a mistress with her two children and his widow with her three.
He was probably born in the Île-de-France, near Paris.
